A

AndroidLog - Class in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.log
Android specific log implementation.

Returns the Android log shared instance.
AUTO - Static variable in interface com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder.ContextRoutineBuilder

B

boundMethod(String) - Method in interface com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder.ObjectContextRoutineBuilder
Returns a routine used to call the method whose identifying name is specified in a Bind annotation.
Optional Timeout, TimeoutAction, ShareGroup, as well as CacheStrategy, ClashResolution and Id method annotations will be honored.
Note that such annotations will override any configuration set through the builder.
buildChannel() - Method in interface com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder.InvocationContextChannelBuilder
Builds and returns an output channel bound to the routine invocation.
buildProxy(Class<TYPE>) - Method in interface com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder.ObjectContextRoutineBuilder
Returns a proxy object enabling asynchronous calling of the target instance methods.
buildProxy(ClassToken<TYPE>) - Method in interface com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder.ObjectContextRoutineBuilder
Returns a proxy object enabling asynchronous calling of the target instance methods.
buildRoutine() - Method in interface com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder.InvocationContextRoutineBuilder

C

CacheStrategy - Annotation Type in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.annotation
This annotation is used to decorate methods that are to be invoked in an asynchronous way.
Through this annotation, it is possible to set a specific cache strategy for a single method invocations.
ClashResolution - Annotation Type in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.annotation
This annotation is used to decorate methods that are to be invoked in an asynchronous way.
Through this annotation, it is possible to set a specific clash resolution for a single method invocations.

Interface defining a routine that can purge specific invocation instances, identifying them by their inputs.
ContextRoutineBuilder - Interface in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder
Interface defining a builder of routines bound to a context lifecycle.
ContextRoutineBuilder.CacheStrategyType - Enum in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder
Result cache type enumeration.
The cache strategy type indicates what will happen to the result of an invocation after its completion.
ContextRoutineBuilder.ClashResolutionType - Enum in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder
Invocation clash resolution enumeration.
The clash of two invocation happens when the same ID is already in use at the time of the routine execution.

F

FactoryContext - Interface in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder
Interface defining a factory providing wrapped object instances, whose methods are to be called inside asynchronous invocations.

G

geInstance(Class<? extends TYPE>, Object...) - Method in interface com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder.FactoryContext
Returns an instance of the object described by the specified parameters.
If a null instance is returned, the constructor matching the specified arguments will be called by default.

I

Id - Annotation Type in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.annotation
This annotation is used to decorate methods that are to be invoked in an asynchronous way.
Through this annotation, it is possible to set a specific invocation ID for a single method.
InputClashException - Exception in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder
Exception indicating a clash of routine invocations with the same ID but different input data.

Constructor.
InvocationClashException - Exception in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder
Exception indicating a clash of routine invocations with the same ID.
InvocationClashException(int) - Constructor for exception com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder.InvocationClashException
Constructor.
InvocationContextChannelBuilder - Interface in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder
Interface defining a builder of output channels bound to routine invocations.
In order to be successfully bound, the specific routine invocation must have a user defined ID and still running (or cached) at the time of the channel creation.
InvocationContextRoutineBuilder<INPUT,OUTPUT> - Interface in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder
Interface defining a builder of routines bound to a context lifecycle.
InvocationMissingException - Exception in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder
Exception indicating that a routine invocation with a specified ID is not running.
InvocationMissingException() - Constructor for exception com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder.InvocationMissingException
Constructor.
InvocationServiceRoutineBuilder<INPUT,OUTPUT> - Interface in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.builder
Interface defining a builder of routine objects based on an invocation class token.
The invocation execution will happen in a dedicated service.

J

JRoutine - Class in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.core
This utility class extends the base Java routine in order to support additional routine builders specific to the Android platform.
Routine invocations created through the returned builder will be execute inside a service specified through the routine builder.
JRoutine() - Constructor for class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.core.JRoutine
 
JRoutine - Class in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.v11.core
This utility class extends the base Java routine in order to support additional routine builders specific to the Android platform.
Routine invocations created through the returned builders can be safely restored after a change in the configuration, so to avoid duplicated calls and memory leaks.
JRoutine() - Constructor for class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.v11.core.JRoutine
 
JRoutine - Class in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.v4.core
This utility class extends the base Java routine in order to support additional routine builders specific to the Android platform.
Routine invocations created through the returned builders can be safely restored after a change in the configuration, so to avoid duplicated calls and memory leaks.
JRoutine() - Constructor for class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.v4.core.JRoutine
 

L

Logs - Class in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.log
Utility class for creating and sharing log instances, employing specific Android classes.
Logs() - Constructor for class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.log.Logs
 
looperRunner(Looper) - Static method in class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.runner.Runners
Returns a runner employing the specified looper.
Note that, waiting for results in the very same thread may result in a deadlock exception.
looperRunner(Looper, Runner) - Static method in class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.runner.Runners
Returns a runner employing the specified looper.
Note that, based on the choice of the runner to be used when the invocation runs in the looper thread, waiting for results in the very same thread may result in a deadlock exception.

M

MainRunner - Class in com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.runner
Implementation of a runner employing the main UI thread looper.
Note that, when the invocation runs in the main thread, the executions with a delay of 0 will be performed synchronously, while the ones with a positive delay will be posted on the UI thread.
MainRunner() - Constructor for class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.runner.MainRunner
Constructor.
mainRunner() - Static method in class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.runner.Runners
Returns the shared runner employing the main thread looper.
Note that, when the invocation runs in the main thread, the executions with a delay of 0 will be performed synchronously, while the ones with a positive delay will be posted on the main thread.

onActivity(Activity, Class<?>) - Static method in class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.v11.core.JRoutine
Returns a builder of routines bound to the specified activity, wrapping the specified object instances.
In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as application.
onActivity(Activity, ClassToken<? extends ContextInvocation<INPUT, OUTPUT>>) - Static method in class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.v11.core.JRoutine
Returns a builder of routines bound to the specified activity.
Note that the specified invocation class must be static and have a default constructor.
Note also that the built routine results will be always dispatched in the main UI thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation in the main thread will result in a deadlock.
onActivity(Activity, int) - Static method in class com.gh.bmd.jrt.android.v11.core.JRoutine
Returns a builder of an output channel bound to the invocation identified by the specified ID.
Note that, if no invocation with the specified ID is running at the time of the channel creation, the output will be aborted with a InvocationMissingException.

In order to customize the object creation, the caller must employ an implementation of a FactoryContext as application.

Note also that the built routine results will be always dispatched in the main UI thread, thus waiting for the outputs immediately after its invocation in the main thread will result in a deadlock.
